intro: Thibaudia corymbodendron, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in corymbs, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or open woodland habitats.
